intro: Corispermum gallicum, commonly known as the French bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its simple, branching stems and small, round leaves that often appear in clusters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically borne in clusters near the water's surface. It is adapted to grow in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and wetlands. Corispermum gallicum is an annual plant, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
